function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inability to establish cause and effect relationships due to cross-sectional design","Impact":"Inability to determine the directional relationship between garden usage and health outcomes","Mitigation":"Conduct longitudinal studies to track the changes in garden usage and health outcomes over time","Technologies":"Longitudinal data collection and analysis tools","People":"Researchers, public health professionals","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Uneven distribution of responses across categories including garden usage frequency","Impact":"Potential bias in the results and conclusions drawn from the study","Mitigation":"Use stratified sampling methods to ensure a balanced representation of different categories","Technologies":"Sampling and survey methods for balanced representation","People":"Researchers, statisticians","Owner":"Research institutions, academic institutions"},{"Description":"Unaccounted for factors affecting health outcomes","Impact":"Potential confounding variables could influence the study results","Mitigation":"Conduct sensitivity analyses and consider additional variables in the analysis","Technologies":"Statistical software for sensitivity analyses and variable inclusion","People":"Data analysts, statisticians","Owner":"Research institutions, data analysis teams"}]}
